Domino Game

Project Description:


Simulation of the popular game "Domino", between the computer and a user.

The game uses gaming pieces called dominoes, that make up a domino set. The set consists of 28 unique dominoes. Each domino is a white, rectangular tile with a line dividing its face into two square ends. Each end is marked with a number of black dots. The domino set is the following (the numbers being the amount of black dots in each end.):

6:6 6:5 6:4 6:3 6:2 6:1 6:0
5:5 5:4 5:3 5:2 5:1 5:0
4:4 4:3 4:2 4:1 4:0
3:3 3:2 3:1 3:0
2:2 2:1 2:0
1:1 1:0
0:0

The game is played in rounds. The first round begins by distributing 6 random dominos to each of the 2 players. The player drawing the highest double plays first. In the absence of a double, the human user will start. The game ends when either a player has no more dominoes in his hand or when neither player can make a play (Blocked Game).

The player who drew the highest double maked the first play, playing any domino he wishes from his had. Each play consist on laying a domino end to end (the touching ends must match: 1s touch 1s, 2s touch 2s, and so on.). If a player cannot perform a move, he must draw from the unused domino pile, or stock, until he can play a domino. If there are no dominoes in the stock, that player becomes blocked and it's turn is skipped, untill he can play a domino from his hand.

The game code is divided into 12 states:
0: Searching for double 0 in hand.
1: Searching for double 1 in hand.
2: Searching for double 2 in hand.
3: Searching for double 3 in hand.
4: Searching for double 4 in hand.
5: Searching for double 5 in hand.
6: Searching for double 6 in hand.
7: Stock is empty and computer cannot play. Computer blocked.
8: Regular play.
9: Stock is empty and player cannot play. Player blocked.
10: A player won the game.
11: Stock is empty. Neither player can play. Game blocked.

In order to make an easier visualization, the following diagrams were made:
